learning_outcomes.description: Explain what we mean by sustainability in the context of the environment, crop and pasture production, livestock production, animal welfare, finance and people.
Discuss the factors which contribute to a successful, sustainable animal, farming and supply chain enterprise.
Propose strategies to improve sustainability across all sectors of an agricultural enterprise, including financial and human resources.
Analyse an agricultural enterprise to determine challenges to sustainability.

assessments.weighting: <dd>15% This assessment is exempt from supplementary. </dd>
assessments.task_description:
Task Summary

Size – Estimated 2000 – 3000 words (combined total). NOTE: Word count is not limited, this task is a reflection activity and needs to cover what it needs to cover.

Presentation – typed, with a cover page.

Background

In this task you will need to provide your own personal reflections on each enterprise you attend, during the 6 day industry tour (Stream 2) of the compulsory field work. You are expected to attend all sessions and write a reflection for each. If students miss an enterprise reflection, they will be awarded 0 marks for that specific reflection. Please note, these activities are not repeatable, there will be no alternative assessment for these enterprises.

Reflection Structure

For each of the enterprises visited, consider the following questions:

1.      Enterprise description: Name, Location, Production enterprise description (i.e. what does this enterprise do?).

2.      Does the enterprise have sustainability goals? If yes, what are they? If no, do opportunities exist?

3.      What did you learn at this enterprise that you didn’t know before visiting? What was it?

4.      Was there anything unexpected that you learned at this enterprise?

5.      Would you recommend this location to friends/colleagues/peers to visit? Why? 

General Formatting and Communication

Task Size – 200-300 words per reflection (excluding references, if used)

What this means is that you are to address the five (5) questions above, where question one (1) does not count towards the word count. This means that your reflection across the whole semester will be about 2000 – 3000 words in total.

General Formatting

Your report must be typed, 1.5 to 2.0 line spacings are ok, font size 12, in Australian (British) English and neatly presented. Communicating your thoughts in a concise and grammatically correct manner is essential to any written document, here at The University of Queensland or outside this institution. One way to check is to read your assignment aloud to yourself, if it is awkward to speak then it is awkward to read. 

Artificial Intelligence

This task is designed to be reflective of your personal experiences with our industry partners. It is envisaged that the use of AI will not be required.

However, Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

The use of AI or MT must be acknowledged appropriately. Please see assessment guidelines in blackboard course site for specific instructions.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You must submit your Assessment task, in Blackboard, via the Turnitin link by the submission deadline. You should also retain an electronic copy of every piece of assessment you submit.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.weighting: <dd>30% This assessment is exempt from supplementary. </dd>

assessments.task_description:
Sustainable Innovation Pitch

Background

This assignment challenges students to develop and deliver a compelling pitch to present an idea for an industry partner on sustainable business innovations. The goal is to present a scenario for a sustainable business opportunity to our industry partner, drawing on your experience gained by visiting industry enterprises. As this activity is being undertaken in collaboration with a commercial partner, the activities associated with this Pitch are not repeatable, as such we are unable to provide an alternative assessment opportunities.

Task

Due to the complexities and challenges associate with External/Remote students this assessment will be an individual assessment task. For this task you are required to prepare and deliver a professional pitch presentation. Your pitch will be 5 min with 2-3 min of question time. Your pitch should clearly communicate your sustainable business opportunity proposition, and the potential impact or value of your idea. 

You must submit a copy of your PowerPoint slides (as a .pdf) to Blackboard, link provided by the submission deadline. Your presentation slides are due for uploaded to Blackboard by midnight Monday October 27th. The Pitch presentations will occur during week 13, via video conference, with a day and time to be confirmed. Once a date and time has been confirmed this activity will be timetabled and appear in your personal timetable.

Artificial Intelligence

This task has been designed to be challenging, authentic and complex. Whilst students may use Artificial Intelligence (AI) and/or Machine Translation (MT) tools, successful completion of assessment in this course will require students to critically engage in specific contexts and tasks for which AI or MT will provide only limited support and guidance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

To pass this assessment, students will be required to demonstrate detailed comprehension of their written submission independent of AI and MT tools.

The use of AI or MT must be acknowledged appropriately. Please see assessment guidelines in blackboard course site for specific instructions.
assessments.submission_guidelines: The powerpoint slide component of this assessment is to be submitted within Blackboard under the appropriate assessment title on your course Blackboard site. You should also retain an electronic copy of every piece of assessment you submit.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.weighting: <dd>15% This assessment is exempt from supplementary. </dd>
assessments.task_description:
Task

For your Pitch , you are also required to develop a 5-page business case pitch report to support your Sustainable Innovation Pitch. This report should demonstrate your ability to identify a market opportunity, develop a viable business model, and communicate the value proposition effectively. Due to the connection with your Sustainable Innovation Pitch, the activities associated with this Pitch are not repeatable as this has been developed in collaboration with a commercial partner, as such we are unable to provide an alternative assessment

Due to the complexities and challenges associate with External/Remote students this assessment will be an individual assessment task.

Your business case pitch report must include the following sections:

1. Executive Summary (Approx. ½ page)

This section will provide a brief overview of the sustainable business innovation and highlight the opportunity, sustainability, and expected outcomes.

2. Opportunity (Approx. 1 page)

This section should describe and justify the opportunity with data or trends.

3. Business Solution (Approx. 1 page)

Describe your product or service, highlight any unique aspects and describe how this opportunity will be sustainable. 

4. Market Analysis (Approx. 1 page)

How does this fit into the business from an industry and market approach?

5. Business Model & Strategy (Approx. 1 page)

Outline a potential revenue model and pricing strategy.

6. Financial Snapshot (Approx. ½ page)

Provide an overview of financial projections (e.g., start-up costs, revenue forecast, break-even). Describe any potential capital expenses.

A more detailed assessment description and rubric will be made available via Blackboard.

Artificial Intelligence

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

The use of AI or MT must be acknowledged appropriately. Please see assessment guidelines in blackboard course site for specific instructions.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You must submit your Assessment task, in Blackboard, via the link provided by the submission deadline. Further instructions will be made available. You should also retain an electronic copy of every piece of assessment you submit.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Exam Structure 

The exam will cover all aspects of the course: Lectures, field trips, assignment and set readings. The exam will be a two-hour written examination with problem solving, short answer and short essay questions, and will be similar in format to previous years. 

Exam details

The exam will be an on-campus exam. Have your UQ student ID card available for all your exams.

Students enrolled in External delivery must attend the exam in-person, either on campus OR at an approved off-campus venue as organized with UQ Examinations. Students who live within a 200km radius of the campus will be expected to attend campus for the exam.

Examinations will contact students directly to confirm arrangements. Please ensure to check your UQ student email account regularly throughout semester as One reminder will be sent and students who fail to nominate an exam centre and will be automatically assigned to sit their exam on campus. Late nominations will not be accepted.

Please ensure you update your semester address in Si-net at the start of the semester to accurately reflect where you are residing.

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 13(28 Jul - 02 Nov)
learning_activities.topic:
Lecture Series

Lectures will cover a broad array of topics that discuss: sustainability Issues and challenges across agriculture, Technology usage for sustainability, Productivity and Stewardship, Managing environments, Conflict or contentious plant species as they apply across all agricultural industries.
learning_activities.topic_description: Lecture Series Lectures will cover a broad array of topics that discuss: sustainability Issues and challenges across agriculture, Technology usage for sustainability, Productivity and Stewardship, Managing environments, Conflict or contentious plant species as they apply across all agricultural industries.

learning_activities.topic:
Industry Exposure Tour (week 9)

Six day field tour in south-east and central Queensland. Participants you can expect to visit sits such as: grazing beef enterprises, organic beef, broadacre cropping, piggery, pecans and citrus. From Sunday 21/09/2025 to Friday 26/09/2025.
